main event: An unidentified flying object was reported near New Orleans, Louisiana on February 6, 1955. The object was tracked on radar at an extremely high speed estimated at approximately 1,500 mph and altitude of approximately 31,000 feet before disappearing from the radar screen at an extremely high rate of speed.
interesting points: The unidentified target was described as solid, non-blinking, and moving at an extremely high speed estimated to be approximately 1,500 mph.
The object was tracked for about 5 minutes before disappearing from the radar screen at an extremely high rate of speed.
No known aircraft were operating in the area at the time, and the target did not conform to the flight pattern of any known type of aircraft.
The object appeared to be metallic in appearance, round or disc-shaped, and high-flying at a fairly rapid rate of speed.

Witnesses observed a strange luminous object traveling in a southwesterly direction at an estimated altitude of 1500 to 2000 feet, giving off a reddish-orange glow, making a sharp right turn, and accelerating rapidly out of sight.
witnesses: Confidential witness, New Orleans Air Route Traffic Control Center, pilots, airport personnel, and students
